intro: Waltheria communis var. dietrichii, commonly known as the Dietrich's common waltheria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically features simple, alternate leaves with a rough texture and prominent veins. Its flowers are usually small, five-petaled, and range in color from pink to white, blooming during the warmer months. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
